alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Coffee; Marshall; Rutherford; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 3:58PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central De Kalb, Marshall, Rutherford, northwestern Warren, southeastern Williamson, Coffee, Bedford and Cannon Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 357 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Smyrna to 6 miles west of Petersburg. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Shelbyville, Lewisburg, Manchester, Woodbury, Tullahoma, Chapel Hill, Wartrace, Eagleville, Bell Buckle, Centertown, Normandy, Beechgrove, Raus, Triune, Fosterville, Rover, Belfast, Rockvale and Bradyville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 between mile markers 75 and 115. Interstate 840 between mile markers 41 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
